result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas S Orr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF423 and 16CF60 called together at 9:51am [mo]
Defendant Thomas S Orr in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court orally motions to amend Count #1 of Case 16CF60 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping, contrary to Wis Stat 946.49(1)(a) a Class A Misdemeanor.
--the Court grants this motion

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "NO CONTEST  " entered on Count #2 and #3 of Case 15CF423 and Amended Count #1 of Case 16CF60; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all remaining counts of both cases 

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Orr

On Count #2 and #3 of Case 15CF423 , the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 30 months.
On Amended Count #1 of Case 16CF60, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 24 months.

Conditions of Probation as to both Case 15CF423 and 16CF60:
-- On Count #2 of Case 15CF423: to serve 25 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH, release privileges can begin once Mr. Orr tests zero for alcohol and illegal drugs, it must zero from thereafter (the Court is aware that Mr. Orr may test positive for THC)
--the Court authorizes transfer of this sentence to another county so long as there is no use of electronic monitoring.
---Mr.Orr is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

--to undergo AODO assessment and follow through as recommended by agent 
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--complete a certified batterer intervention program
--no contact with Steven Martinez
--contact with Samantha Williams and biological children as approved by agent
--to pay statutory costs
--$30 in subpoena fees in Case 15CF423
--$120 in subpoena fees in Case 16CF60

Case 15CF423: Days Credit= 1 day 
Case 16CF60: 
Days Credit = 0 days

The Court grants parties 20 days to submit a stipulation regarding additional days credit. 
recess: 10:40am
Jury trial on May 23, 2016 or May 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on May 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Cases 16CF60 and 15CF423 called at 8:49am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Thomas S Orr in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF60 - 
Preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver form submitted.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding and intent.  Court accepts the waiver.
Court finds probable cause that the Def. committed a felony and binds the Def. over for arraignment and trial.
ARRAIGNMENT:
Information filed.  Service of Information admitted; reading waived.  Maximum penalties recited.  
Not guilty plea entered as to all counts.  
SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND by the defense.  

15CF423 - 
Court accepts the agreement of counsel to call this case earlier than the scheduled 9am time and agree that doing so does not violate victim rights. 
Arguments regarding bond presented by counsel. 
Court finds probable cause to believe that the defendant has violated the conditions of release; presents basis. 
Court orders a $1,000.00 CASH bond in this matter; presents basis with the same conditions as previously ordered. 

Scheduling on both cases addressed by the Court and Counsel:
FSSC - 5/17/16 at 9am
Jury - 5/23/16 and 5/24/16 at 8:30am
Recess 9am

NEXT: (Notices to be mailed.)
FSSC - 5/17/16 at 9am
Jury - 5/23/16 and 5/24/16 at 8:30am

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas S Orr
Current: 819 Birch Lane, Tomah, WI 54660 United States  (Effective: 02-16-2016)
Prior: N5972 Cty Rd. Tt, Marshall, WI 53559

Case called at 1:40 pm [sf]  
Defendant Thomas S Orr appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Court verifies DOB. 
Defendant provides updated address.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing requested within the time limits by the defendant.

The Court requires a $2,500 signature bond, with conditions:
--No contact with Steven Martinez, Samantha Williams or Felicity
--No presence at 176 1/2 N. Monroe in Waterloo
--Contact with John only as premitted by prior court order and consistant with prior court order

recess 1:1:54 pm 
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 3/8/16 at 8:30 am
